flawed_nl_solution:
He gets his pool cleaned 30/3=<<30/3=10>>10 times a month
Each time he gets it cleaned he tips 150*0.1=$<<150*0.1=15>>15
So he pays 150+15=$<<150+15=160>>160
So he pays 160*10=$<<160*10=1600>>1600 a month on cleaning
The chemicals cost 200*2=$<<200*2=400>>400
So in total, he pays 1600+400=$<<1600+400=2000>>2000
#### 2000

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 165, not 160. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
